text: Microbiota” originally referred to actual microbes inhabiting a body site, whereas “microbiome” referred to the gene pool within those microbes.
The consortium of colonizing microbes has been dubbed the human microbiota or microbiome.
These include bacteria, archaea, fungi, viruses, and even some protozoa.
From the moment of our birth to the time of our death, we are constantly populated by microbes.
